intro: Carpotroche bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia carpotroche, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
